page.title: 16GREAT COMP COUNTRY HOUSE.
page.content: This large country house was built in the 17th century and still looks the sane as when it was first built, despite many alterations, particularly to the rear of the building which were made during the 19th century. During the early part of the 20th century Great Comp was a centre for womem's cricket. A ground with a pavillion were built by the owner Mrs. Heron Maxwell. When it was not used by the women the men of Platt played there. The house is besr known for its beautiful gardens which are open to the public. Mr. Robert Baldwin, a builder, was involved with modernizatin work at Comp. He remembers when it was possble to know everybody in the village. He thinks there are too many modern buildings which have spoiled the village, but he still likes it there.
